meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or revulsion.
meanings.sent1: The slimy texture of the food gave me an ick.
meanings.sent2: The sight of the bug crawling on the wall filled me with ick.
meanings.sent3: I couldn't help but make an ick face when I saw the spoiled milk.
meanings.sent4: The overflowing garbage can was a mountain of ick.
meanings.sent5: The smell coming from the dumpster was a wave of ick that hit me as soon as I turned the corner.

meanings.sent1: She icked at the thought of touching the slimy frog.
meanings.sent2: I ick whenever I see someone sneeze without covering their mouth.
meanings.sent3: The idea of eating bugs really icks me out.
meanings.sent4: The creepy crawly spiders always manage to ick me.
meanings.sent5: The foul odor from the sewer grate never fails to ick me as I walk by.

meanings.sent1: The mystery meat in the cafeteria was a definite ick.
meanings.sent2: The movie had too much blood and gore, it was an ick.
meanings.sent3: The slimy seaweed on the beach was a real ick to walk through.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned house was full of all sorts of ick.
meanings.sent5: The overflowing trash can was a visual representation of ick in the alley.
